snippet: In the latest clash, South Sudanese officials said Wednesday that their forces had taken control of an oil-rich border town that is claimed by Sudan.
abstract: South Sudanese officials say that their forces have taken control of a contested town in an oil-rich area along the border with Sudan, in the latest battle between two countries that are edging toward outright war; South Sudan's secession in 2011after decades of conflict, left a number of contested strategic areas and a landscape of residual tensions.
lead_paragraph: In the latest clash, South Sudanese officials said Wednesday that their forces had taken control of an oil-rich border town that is claimed by Sudan.

headline.seo: South Sudan Says It Has Taken Over Town at Sudan Border
headline.main: South Sudan Says It Has Taken Over Disputed Town
headline.print_headline: South Sudan Says It Controls Disputed Town
